snippet: To help sustain Africa’s lion population, Maasai tribesmen devised their own Olympics, a less sanguinary way to keep their hunting skills honed.
abstract: Wildlife conservation group Big Life Foundation teams with Maasai villages in Africa for second annual Maasai Olympics, which addresses problem of diminishing lion population by providing youngsters with rights of passage other than lion hunting.
lead_paragraph: To help sustain Africa’s lion population, Maasai tribesmen devised their own Olympics, a less sanguinary way to keep their hunting skills honed.

headline.seo: Maasai Tribesmen in Kenya Hold Their Own Olympics
